p: Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) is a very common neurodegenerative disease characterized by motor symptoms, such as rigidity, bradykinesia and tremor, and non-motor symptoms, including sleep disorders and cognitive abnormalities [ 45]. The principal causes of this pathology are the depletion of dopamine in nerve terminals to the striatum and the progressive degeneration of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra [ 46]. The therapy involves the use of levodopa associated with an inhibitor of the peripheral metabolism of levodopa, for example carbidopa. Additionally, other drugs can be administrated, such as dopaminergic agonists, monoamine oxidase-B inhibitors and catechol O-methyltransferase inhibitors [ 47].
